result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie S. Chao was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>2500-10,000g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two.

Counseling/assessment/treatment as required by the department.  
DNA sample.
Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

of Sentencing Hearing on 5/7/2014

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:33 am 
State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Jay Kronenwetter. 
Argument. Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS 5 years imprisonment - 1 year initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision - CONDITIONS OF ES: maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; AODA; counseling/assessment/treatment as required by the dept; payment of court costs; DNA sample. 
COURT finds deft is entitled to 119 days jail credit and is eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT remands deft to the custody of the sheriff for transport to prison. 
Adj: 10:11 am
Sentencing hearing on May 7, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Case called:  8:43 am
Clerk: Kim

State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard
Defendant appears in custody and w/Atty Jay Kronenwetter

Date and time set for plea hearing.  Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  State recites agreement.  Counsel agrees to cap prison at 4 years, 18 mos. IC/36 mos. ES, and no PSI.

State moves to DRI counts 2 and 3.  COURT grants.

PLEA: count 1 as on information>>  Guilty

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

Next hearing:  Sentencing 5/7/14 at 9:30 am in Br. 3
Victims right not applicable.
Bond continues.
Adjourned:  8:56 am
Plea hearing on April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:44 am 
State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Jay Kronenwetter. 
Date and Time set for defense's motion for bond modification. 
Court notes there is no written motion and questions State regarding proceeding without a filed motion. State has no objection to proceeding with bond motion today. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. COURT denies motion for bond modification. 
COURT sets matter for calendar call on 4/2/2014 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA to schedule PTC, FPT, and Jury Trial. 
Adj: 10:52 am
Motion hearing on March 27, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on March 10, 2014 at 01:10 pm.
